text: Dollar Keeps Gains as Market Awaits Data  TOKYO (Reuters) - The dollar idled on Tuesday after gaining  the previous day, as many investors held off building positions  ahead of economic data from the United States.

Traders were focused on the U.S. consumer price index (CPI) data due on Wednesday, which could influence the Fed's monetary policy stance. "The market is in a wait-and-see mode ahead of the CPI data," said a currency strategist at a major Japanese bank. The yen remained under pressure, hovering near multi-month lows, as the Bank of Japan's ultra-loose monetary policy continued to contrast sharply with the Fed's tightening stance. Traders are also keeping an eye on geopolitical developments, including U.S.-China trade tensions, which could further impact currency markets. Overall, the dollar's resilience reflects its status as a safe-haven asset amid ongoing economic uncertainty.
